channel.title: Talks By Thomas S. Monson
channel.description: General Conference talks by Thomas S. Monson.

image.title: General Conference talks by Thomas S. Monson.

item.title: Lost Battalions
item.description: This past November I stood on a very old bridge which spans the River Somme as it makes its steady but unhurried way through the heartland of France. Suddenly I realized that fifty-two years had come—then gone—since the signing of the Armistice of 19

item.title: With Hand and Heart
item.description: Yesterday each person assembled in this historic Tabernacle was given the privilege to raise his right hand to sustain, in the positions to which they have been called, the leadership of the Church. The upraised hand is an outward expression of an in

item.title: “Finishers Wanted”
item.description: On sunlit days during the noon hour, the streets of Salt Lake City abound with men and women who for a moment leave the confines of the tall office buildings and engage in that universal delight called window shopping. On occasion I, too, am a partic

item.title: Hands
item.description: When Jesus of Nazareth taught and ministered among men, he spoke not as did the scribes and scholars of the day but rather in language understood by all. Jesus taught through parables. His teachings moved men and motivated them to a newness of life.

item.title: Yellow Canaries with Gray on Their Wings
item.description: Some 23 years ago I was called as a young man to serve as the bishop of a large ward in Salt Lake City. The magnitude of the calling was overwhelming and the responsibility frightening. My inadequacy humbled me. But my Heavenly Father did not leave m

item.title: “Behold Thy Mother”
item.description: One summer day I stood alone in the quiet of the American War Memorial Cemetery of the Philippines. A spirit of reverence filled the warm tropical air. Situated among the carefully mowed grass, acre upon acre, were markers identifying men, mostly you

item.title: The Paths Jesus Walked
item.description: My beloved brothers and sisters, my heart is full to overflowing. You and I, this memorable day, have been partakers of the Spirit of the Lord Jesus Christ. This is his church. It bears his name. His prophet has lifted each of us beyond the shackles

item.title: My Personal Hall of Fame
item.description: President Kimball, as this conference comes speedily to its close, the words of the apostle Peter seem to reflect the feelings of each person who has attended the conference or who has listened to or viewed the proceedings.

item.title: The Way Home
item.description: Overlooking the azure blue waters of the famed Sea of Galilee is a historic landmark: the Mount of Beatitudes. Like a living sentinel with an eyewitness testimony, this silent friend seems to declare: “Here it was that the greatest person who ever li

item.title: The Faith of a Child
item.description: What a truly glorious period of the year is conference time. Temple Square in Salt Lake City is the gathering place for tens of thousands who travel far, that they might hear the word of the Lord. Today the Tabernacle is filled to overflowing. Friend

item.title: Hopeless Dawn—Joyful Morning
item.description: I am truly honored to follow at this pulpit the President of the Church, even the prophet of God, Spencer W. Kimball. My thoughts today have been centered on the land of his forebears, even Great Britain.

item.title: Which Road Will You Travel?
item.description: A ribbon of black asphalt wends its way through the mountains of northern Utah into the valley of the Great Salt Lake, then meanders southward on its appointed course. Interstate 15 is its official name. This super freeway carries the output of facto

item.title: Your Jericho Road
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters, I seek the help of our Heavenly Father as I respond to the invitation to speak to you today. A great number of you have journeyed many miles to attend this conference. From the north, the south, the east, and the west yo

item.title: The Way of the Lord
item.description: Frequently we sing the hymn, “Come, listen to a prophet’s voice and hear the word of God.” ( no. 46.) Today we have listened to the voice of a prophet, Spencer W. Kimball, proclaim the word of God.

item.title: The Prayer of Faith
item.description: Our hearts are touched by the beautiful singing of these precious Primary boys and girls. All of the children participating here this afternoon enjoy the privilege of associating once each week with others of similar age in the meetings of the Primar

item.title: Profiles of Faith
item.description: Who can help but be uplifted and inspired just to worship in this historic tabernacle and to listen to this glorious choir?

item.title: The Army of the Lord
item.description: Tonight I am aware that you, my brethren, represent the largest gathering of the priesthood ever to assemble. I pray for the help of our Heavenly Father, that he may grant me inspiration coupled with courage.

item.title: Pornography—the Deadly Carrier
item.description: This week, my brothers and sisters, the woodcutters are laying their massive axes and taking their power saws to the still stately and once mighty elm trees that grace the countryside surrounding London, England’s, Heathrow Airport.

item.title: Preparing the Way
item.description: We welcome to their new responsibilities and opportunities President Dwan J. Young and her counselors, Virginia B. Cannon and Michaelene P. Grassli. Certainly President Naomi Shumway and her counselors, Colleen B. Lemmon and Dorthea Lou C. Murdock, h

item.title: The Bishop—Center Stage in Welfare
item.description: Long years ago, the Apostle Paul wrote an epistle to his beloved associate Timothy in which he spoke of the qualifications a bishop should possess. He began:

item.title: The Long Line of the Lonely
item.description: Today I desire to preach no sermon nor deliver a formal message. Rather, may I simply share with you my innermost thoughts. President David O. McKay referred to such as “heart petals.” I open to your view a window to my soul.

item.title: “He Is Risen”
item.description: Not long ago a visitor asked, “What is there to see while I am in Salt Lake City?” Instinctively I suggested a tour of Temple Square, a drive to the nearby canyons, a visit to the Bingham copper mine, and perhaps a swim in the Great Salt Lake. A fear

item.title: Sailing Safely the Seas of Life
item.description: On February 14, 1939, Americans were celebrating Valentine’s Day. Postmen delivered sealed envelopes, and small children placed at the doorsteps of special friends folded papers containing brightly colored pictures. Each contained a greeting—a messag

item.title: “Run, Boy, Run!”
item.description: Tuesday, June 8, 1982, dawned bright and clear in London, England. It was destined to be an historic day. A spirit of excitement permeated the very air and filled expectant hearts with keen anticipation. The President of the United States of America

item.title: “Anonymous”
item.description: Recently, I approached the reception desk of a large hospital to learn the room number of a patient I had come to visit. This hospital, like almost every other in the land, was undergoing a massive expansion. Behind the desk where the receptionist sa

item.title: Labels
item.description: The National Gallery at Trafalgar Square in London, England, is one of the truly great museums of art in all the world. The gallery proudly proclaims its Rembrandt Room and Constable Corner and urges all to take the tour of Turner’s masterpieces. Vis

item.title: Building Your Eternal Home
item.description: When Jesus walked the dusty pathways of towns and villages that we now reverently call the Holy Land and taught His disciples by beautiful Galilee, He often spoke in parables, in language the people understood best. Frequently, He referred to home bu

item.title: The Aaronic Priesthood Pathway
item.description: Every missionary in the Church is acquainted with the scriptural passage from the book of Amos: “Surely the Lord God will do nothing, but he revealeth his secret unto his servants the prophets.” (.) Every member of the Church rejoices in singing the

item.title: “The Spirit Giveth Life”
item.description: Recently I visited the Missionary Training Center at Provo, Utah, where missionaries who have been called to serve throughout the world are devotedly learning the fundamentals of the languages spoken by the people to whom they shall teach and testify

item.title: Those Who Love Jesus
item.description: Driving on the modern freeways during the sunshine of summer is often a pleasant experience. Frequently, one can view the grandeur of majestic mountains and the mesmerizing surf of the sea all in a single drive. However, when the traffic is heavy, th

item.title: The Call of Duty
item.description: Whenever I have the privilege to attend this, the general priesthood meeting of the Church, I reflect on the teachings of some of the most noble of God’s leaders who have stood at this pulpit and who, from the brilliance of their minds, from the dept

item.title: A Provident Plan—A Precious Promise
item.description: Today, April 6, 1986, is a day of history. One hundred fifty-six years ago The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints was organized. Numbers were few. Circumstances were modest. But the future beckoned. In Solemn Assembly this afternoon, Preside

item.title: Courage Counts
item.description: Tonight, those who hold the priesthood fill the Tabernacle on Temple Square, have overflowed to the adjacent Assembly Hall, and are assembled in chapels and halls ranging in size from the mammoth Marriott Center at Brigham Young University to the sma

item.title: Your Patriarchal Blessing: A Liahona of Light
item.description: Have you ever cleaned an attic or rummaged through an old storeroom? One discovers a bit of history and a whole lot of sentiment. A few weeks ago we emptied the attic of our mountain cabin. Seventy years of treasures, each with its own special memory

item.title: Tears, Trials, Trust, Testimony
item.description: Have you ever pondered the worth of a human soul? Have you ever wondered concerning the potential which lies within each of us?

item.title: The Will Within
item.description: A few months ago I stood before a capacity audience in the Marriott Center on the campus of Brigham Young University. Mine was the responsibility to speak, to lift, to motivate, to inspire. There came to my mind the realization that here were men and

item.title: Missionary Memories
item.description: What an inspiring sight to see this historic tabernacle filled to capacity, then to realize that chapels and halls throughout the world are similarly filled by those who hold the priesthood of God. I pray for the inspiration of heaven to attend me an

item.title: A Doorway Called Love
item.description: Recently there moved over the wires of Associated Press a catalog of crime as the daily happenings around the world were relayed to the media and thence to the homes on every continent.

item.title: You Make a Difference
item.description: David declares in one of his beautiful and moving psalms, “O Lord our Lord, how excellent is thy name in all the earth! …

item.title: An Invitation to Exaltation
item.description: Everywhere, people are in a hurry. Jet-powered planes speed their precious human cargo across broad continents and vast oceans. Appointments must be kept, tourist attractions beckon, and friends and family await the arrival of a particular flight. Mo

item.title: Happiness through Service
item.description: President Benson has suggested that I bear my testimony to you at this time. I am pleased to again express my witness that God lives, that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of the Living God, that this work is true, and that happiness comes through servin

item.title: Goal beyond Victory
item.description: Years ago, many of us participated as players or observers in the all-Church basketball tournaments and later in the softball tournaments. The most coveted prize was not to be adjudged first-place winner, but rather to receive the sportsmanship award

item.title: Hallmarks of a Happy Home
item.description: “Happiness is the object and design of our existence; and will be the end thereof, if we pursue the path that leads to it; and this path is virtue, uprightness, faithfulness, holiness, and keeping all the commandments of God.” (Joseph Smith, sel. by

item.title: Go For It!
item.description: Brethren, you are an inspiring sight to behold. It is awesome to realize that in thousands of chapels throughout the world at this hour, your fellow holders of the priesthood of God are receiving this broadcast by way of satellite transmission. Your

item.title: Thanks Be to God
item.description: In the first section of the Doctrine and Covenants, we read the Lord’s promise:

item.title: The Service That Counts
item.description: While driving to the office one morning, I passed a dry-cleaning establishment which had a sign by the side of the front door. It read, “It’s the Service That Counts.” I suppose in a highly competitive field such as the dry-cleaning business and many

item.title: Windows
item.description: While waiting my turn at an airline office in London, England, I reached forward from my chair and selected an advertising brochure from the small table which contained reading material. The publication bore the title, Each page contained a framed p

item.title: Conference Is Here
item.description: President Benson has suggested that I commence this conference with a brief message given in his behalf and that I convey to listeners and viewers far and near his greeting, his love, and his blessing.

item.title: My Brother’s Keeper
item.description: The Holy Bible is an inspiration to me. This sacred book has inspired the minds of men and has motivated readers to live the commandments of God and to love one another. It is printed in greater quantities, is translated into more languages, and has

item.title: “A Little Child Shall Lead Them”
item.description: During the Galilean ministry of our Lord and Savior, the disciples came unto Him, saying, “Who is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?

item.title: The Lighthouse of the Lord
item.description: My dear sisters, the spirit which permeates this meeting here in the historic Tabernacle and in hundreds of chapels and stake centers in many parts of the world is a reflection of your strength, your devotion, your goodness. To quote the words of the

item.title: That We May Touch Heaven
item.description: One of my most vivid memories is attending priesthood meeting as a newly ordained deacon and singing the opening hymn, “Come, All Ye Sons of God Who Have Received the Priesthood.” Tonight, to this capacity audience assembled in the Tabernacle and in

item.title: Days Never to Be Forgotten
item.description: As the year 1990 moves inexorably toward its close, all members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints can pause and reflect on the momentous happenings that have occurred in our time, in our day, and in our lives.

item.title: “God Be with You Till We Meet Again”
item.description: There is a loneliness in the empty chair between President Hinckley and me, and we feel it in our hearts. I wish I could take you with President Hinckley and me to President Benson’s hospital room, which we visited a few days ago. I think the picture

item.title: The Power of Prayer
item.description: My beloved brothers and sisters, it has been customary for the President of the Church to welcome you and deliver a message at the commencement of conference. With all his noble heart, President Benson would desire to stand at this pulpit and bear to

item.title: A Royal Priesthood
item.description: My brethren of the priesthood worldwide, you are an inspiring audience. To use a word favored by the youth of today, it is an “awesome” responsibility to speak to you. I pray for the Lord’s help.

item.title: Never Alone
item.description: This Sabbath day has been designated as a day of thanksgiving, a day of gratitude—even a day of prayer. We pause, we ponder, we reflect on the blessings an all-wise Heavenly Father has bestowed upon us, His children, by bringing peace to the battlefi

item.title: “Called to Serve”
item.description: One cannot gaze into the faces of this vast congregation of men assembled in the historic Tabernacle and envision the unseen audiences meeting in other locations throughout the world without feeling your strength, recognizing your faith, and knowing

item.title: Precious Children—A Gift from God
item.description: From the book of Matthew we learn that after Jesus and His disciples descended from the Mount of Transfiguration, they paused at Galilee, then came to Capernaum. The disciples said unto Jesus, “Who is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?

item.title: “The Lord Bless You”
item.description: Traditionally, the President of the Church provides closing remarks at the conclusion of conference. How we would enjoy hearing from President Benson! We are grateful that now, in his ninety-third year, he is free from pain, able to move about, meet

item.title: The Spirit of Relief Society
item.description: Today our souls have reached toward heaven. We have been blessed with beautiful music and inspired messages. The Spirit of the Lord is here.

item.title: Memories of Yesterday, Counsel for Today
item.description: How our beloved prophet and President, Ezra Taft Benson, would enjoy standing at this pulpit to open a glorious conference of the Church. President Benson, we love you; we pray for you; we are anxious to follow your inspired direction.

item.title: To Learn, To Do, To Be
item.description: Truly a royal priesthood has assembled tonight. The Tabernacle on Temple Square is filled to overflowing, and the Assembly Hall is occupied, as are chapels throughout many countries in the world. In all likelihood this is the largest assemblage of pr

item.title: An Attitude of Gratitude
item.description: On this Sabbath day our thoughts turn to Him who atoned for our sins, who showed us the way to live and how to pray, and who demonstrated by His own actions the blessings of service. Born in a stable, cradled in a manger, this Son of God, even Jesus

item.title: “An Example of the Believers”
item.description: This has been a beautiful and rewarding meeting. I endorse the counsel provided by President Howard W. Hunter and that given by each of the sisters who has addressed us. As I contemplate the vast audience assembled tonight, I ponder the words of Pres

item.title: The Priesthood in Action
item.description: What a glorious sight is before me tonight! Here in the Tabernacle on Temple Square, in the Assembly Hall, at the BYU Marriott Center, and gathered together in chapels scattered throughout the world is a might army of men—even the royal army of the L

item.title: Miracles—Then and Now
item.description: Almost forty years ago I received an invitation to meet with President J. Reuben Clark, Jr., a Counselor in the First Presidency of the Church, a statesman of towering stature, and a scholar of international renown. My profession then was in the fiel

item.title: At Parting
item.description: Traditionally, the President of the Church, the Lord’s prophet, seer, and revelator, provides the concluding expressions of a general conference and gives his blessing to all. Humbly and respectfully I respond to the assignment to represent him at th

item.title: The Temple of the Lord
item.description: My beloved brothers and sisters, it is customary for the President of the Church to open each conference, to greet the Saints worldwide, and to set the tone of all that follows. Since President Benson is unable to be with us in person, I respond to h

item.title: Search and Rescue
item.description: During the seemingly never-ending years of the Vietnam conflict, we frequently heard through the media’s blaring voice the term This phrase helped explain to the public the peculiar nature of combat in that area of dense jungle, oppressive heat, and

item.title: Gifts
item.description: President David O. McKay would frequently suggest the need for us to turn from the hectic day-to-day schedule filled with letters to answer, calls to be made, people to see, meetings to attend, and take time to meditate, to ponder, and to reflect on

item.title: The Upward Reach
item.description: My dear friends and fellow Scouters, Jere Ratcliffe, Bud Reid, and Mike Hoover, you honor me tonight by your attendance and with your remarks. I am humbled by the presentation of the Bronze Wolf Award. I know that as you bestow this honor, you are al

item.title: Meeting Life’s Challenges
item.description: Thirty years ago this conference, I was called and sustained as a member of the Council of the Twelve Apostles. On that occasion I asked earnestly for your faith and your prayers. And today as my opportunity to speak to you has come, I renew that req

item.title: The Priesthood—A Sacred Trust
item.description: What a solemn thought, to contemplate the vast priesthood audience assembled here in the Tabernacle on Temple Square and gathered in hundreds of buildings throughout the world! I sincerely pray for the Spirit of the Lord to guide my remarks this even

item.title: The Path to Peace
item.description: On this beautiful Easter morning, prayers of gratitude for the life and mission of our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ, fill the Sabbath air while strains of inspiring music comfort our hearts and whisper to our souls the ageless salutation, “Peace be

item.title: What He Would Have Us Do
item.description: We have missed Elder Marvin J. Ashton and another familiar soul at our conferences, D. Arthur Haycock, each of whom has passed away since our last conference. Our hearts and our prayers go out to Sister Ashton, Sister Haycock, and all who have loved

item.title: My Brother’s Keeper
item.description: My dear brethren, I am confident that you, as I, have seen the newscasts on television and have heard them on radio, have read feature articles published by weekly and monthly magazines, and have observed the glaring headlines in daily newspapers. Th

item.title: The Fatherless and the Widows—Beloved of God
item.description: Many years ago I attended a large gathering of Church members in the city of Berlin, Germany. A spirit of quiet reverence permeated the gathering as an organ prelude of hymns was played. I gazed at those who sat before me. There were mothers and fath

item.title: A Time to Choose
item.description: What an imposing and inspiring throng are you young women, your mothers, and your leaders as you meet together this evening on this sacred occasion. All of us have been uplifted by the beauty—even the majesty—portrayed in what we have heard, what we

item.title: The Solemn Assembly Sustaining of Church Officers
item.description: Brothers and sisters, President Hinckley has requested that I now handle the business of the solemn assembly for which we are met. This is an occasion of great significance for members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints throughout the

item.title: That All May Hear
item.description: Brethren, you are an inspiring sight to behold. It is gratifying to realize that in thousands of chapels throughout the world, holders of the priesthood of God are receiving this broadcast by way of satellite transmission. Your nationalities vary and

item.title: Mercy—The Divine Gift
item.description: Not long ago, I read a lengthy report concerning the violence and bloodshed that continue to stalk the land of what was once Yugoslavia. The killing and maiming seem to go on, despite the efforts put forth to bring peace. The account of a sniper taki

item.title: Who Honors God, God Honors
item.description: It is no small undertaking to stand before you this evening. I am impressed by your faith, in awe of your potential, and inspired by your devotion to duty in the cause of the Master.

item.title: Patience—A Heavenly Virtue
item.description: Recently I met an old friend I had not seen for some time. He greeted me with the salutation, “How is the world treating you?” I don’t recall the specifics of my reply, but his provocative question caused me to reflect on my many blessings and my gra

item.title: Duty Calls
item.description: What a vast audience is attending this general priesthood meeting this evening. The Apostle Peter aptly described you: “Ye are a chosen generation, a royal priesthood, an holy nation, a peculiar people; that ye should shew forth the praises of him wh

item.title: The Way of the Master
item.description: During the later Judean ministry of the Lord, “a certain lawyer stood up, and tempted him, saying, Master, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?

item.title: Christ at Bethesda’s Pool
item.description: One of the most famous art galleries in the world is the National Gallery of Art, situated adjacent to Trafalgar Square in the city of London, England. The gallery has on display many priceless masterpieces.

item.title: “Be Thou an Example”
item.description: As I contemplate the vast audience assembled for this general priesthood meeting of the Church, I seek the help of our Heavenly Father as I approach my responsibility to speak to you.

item.title: Pioneers All
item.description: My young sisters, we really don’t know how much good we can do until we put forth the effort.

item.title: They Will Come
item.description: Let us, with faith unwavering and with love unstinting, be bridge builders to the hearts of those with whom we labor.

item.title: They Showed the Way
item.description: Jesus Christ, Savior of the world … was and is the ultimate pioneer, for He has gone before, showing all others the way to follow.

item.title: The Mighty Strength of the Relief Society
item.description: May we gain knowledge through study. May we make home a heaven. May we find joy in service.

item.title: Teach the Children
item.description: Children learn through gentle direction and persuasive teaching. They search for models to imitate, knowledge to acquire, things to do, and teachers to please.

item.title: Home Teaching—a Divine Service
item.description: Can we … reach out to those for whom we are responsible and bring them to the table of the Lord to feast on His word and to enjoy the companionship of His Spirit?

item.title: In Harm’s Way
item.description: There is a battle of significant consequence taking place in the lives of young men today. In simple terms, it is the struggle between doing right or doing wrong.

item.title: Look to God and Live
item.description: Whenever we are inclined to feel burdened down with the blows of life, let us remember that others have passed the same way, have endured, and then have overcome.

item.title: Think to Thank
item.description: Do we give thanks to God “for his unspeakable gift” [2 Cor. 9:15] and His rich blessings so abundantly bestowed upon us?

item.title: Today Determines Tomorrow
item.description: Let each of us learn of Him, believe in Him, trust in Him, follow Him, obey Him. By so doing, we can become like Him.

item.title: Your Celestial Journey
item.description: There will come those teaching times to each of you when you will witness the love of your mother, the strength of your father, and the inspiration of God.

item.title: The Priesthood—Mighty Army of the Lord
item.description: One of the greatest safeguards we have in the Church is a strong, firm, committed, dedicated, and testifying Melchizedek Priesthood base.

item.title: For I Was Blind, but Now I See
item.description: If you want to give a light to others, you have to glow yourself.

item.title: Becoming Our Best Selves
item.description: When we [trust in the Lord], we will come to realize that we have been on His holy errand, that His divine purposes have been fulfilled, and that we have shared in that fulfillment.

item.title: Priesthood Power
item.description: The priesthood is not really so much a gift as it is a commission to serve, a privilege to lift, and an opportunity to bless the lives of others.

item.title: Your Eternal Voyage
item.description: Let us consider our callings, let us reflect on our responsibilities, let us determine our duty, and let us follow Jesus Christ our Lord.

item.title: Your Eternal Home
item.description: In a very real sense, we are builders of eternal houses. We are apprentices to the trade—not skilled craftsmen. We need divine help if we are to build successfully.

item.title: The Call to Serve
item.description: I revere the priesthood of Almighty God. I have witnessed its power. I have seen its strength. I have marveled at the miracles it has wrought.

item.title: Dedication Day
item.description: As an expression of our love for the Lord, could we not rededicate our lives and our homes in a like manner?

item.title: Compassion
item.description: We have no way of knowing when our privilege to extend a helping hand will unfold before us.

item.title: To the Rescue
item.description: Brethren, the world is in need of your help. There are feet to steady, hands to grasp, minds to encourage, hearts to inspire, and souls to save.

item.title: “Be Thou an Example”
item.description: Fill your mind with truth; fill your heart with love; fill your life with service.

item.title: Duty Calls
item.description: All of us have a solemn duty to honor the priesthood and labor to bring many precious souls unto the Lord.

item.title: Now Is the Time
item.description: May we live so that when that final summons is heard, we may have no serious regrets, no unfinished business.

item.title: Pathways to Perfection
item.description: Exemplify in your lives four tested, specific virtues: an attitude of gratitude, a longing for learning, a devotion to discipline, and a willingness to work.

item.title: Hidden Wedges
item.description: Let’s not pass to future generations the grievances, the anger of our time. Let’s remove any hidden wedges that can do nothing but destroy.

item.title: They Pray and They Go
item.description: Let us, as a mighty body of priesthood, be doers of the word, and not hearers only. Let us pray, then let us go and do.

item.title: Peace, Be Still
item.description: His words in holy writ are sufficient: “Be still, and know that I am God.”

item.title: Models to Follow
item.description: All of us living in the world today need points of reference—even models to follow.

item.title: In Search of Treasure
item.description: Learn from the past, prepare for the future, live in the present.

item.title: Stand in Your Appointed Place
item.description: May we reach out and rescue those who have fallen by the wayside, that not one precious soul will be lost.

item.title: Bring Him Home
item.description: We can, with the Lord’s help, reach out and rescue those for whom we have responsibility.

item.title: The Bridge Builder
item.description: Jesus Christ … has built the bridges over which we must cross if we are to reach our heavenly home.

item.title: Your Personal Influence
item.description: As we follow that Man of Galilee—even the Lord Jesus Christ—our personal influence will be felt for good wherever we are, whatever our callings.

item.title: The Call for Courage
item.description: Let us have the courage to defy the consensus, the courage to stand for principle. Courage, not compromise, brings the smile of God’s approval.

item.title: If Ye Are Prepared Ye Shall Not Fear
item.description: We do live in turbulent times. Often the future is unknown; therefore, it behooves us to prepare for uncertainties.

item.title: Anxiously Engaged
item.description: There are quorum members and those who should be our quorum members who require our help.

item.title: Choose You This Day
item.description: The choices we make determine our destiny.

item.title: Be Thou an Example
item.description: You can share your testimony in many ways—by the words you speak, by the example you set, by the manner in which you live your life.

item.title: Constant Truths for Changing Times
item.description: We, as members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, must stand up to the dangers which surround us and our families.

item.title: The Sacred Call of Service
item.description: The performance of one’s duty brings a sense of happiness and peace.

item.title: Do Your Duty—That Is Best
item.description: The priesthood is not really so much a gift as it is a commission to serve, a privilege to lift, and an opportunity to bless the lives of others.

item.title: The Prophet Joseph Smith: Teacher by Example
item.description: May we incorporate into our own lives the divine principles which [Joseph Smith] so beautifully taught—by example—that we, ourselves, might live more completely the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: True to the Faith
item.description: Let us resolve here and now to follow that straight path which leads home to the Father of us all.

item.title: Our Sacred Priesthood Trust
item.description: The priesthood is not really so much a gift as it is a commission to serve, a privilege to lift, and an opportunity to bless the lives of others.

item.title: True to Our Priesthood Trust
item.description: It is in doing—not just dreaming—that lives are blessed, others are guided, and souls are saved.

item.title: How Firm a Foundation
item.description: We can fortify our foundations of faith, our testimonies of truth, so that we will not falter, we will not fail.

item.title: I Know That My Redeemer Lives!
item.description: Because our Savior died at Calvary, death has no hold upon any one of us.

item.title: Tabernacle Memories
item.description: As this building is rededicated today, may we pledge to rededicate our lives to the work of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ.

item.title: The Priesthood—a Sacred Gift
item.description: It is our responsibility to conduct our lives so that we are ever worthy of the priesthood we bear.

item.title: Three Goals to Guide You
item.description: Your influence ranges far beyond yourself and your home and touches others all around the globe.

item.title: Mrs. Patton—the Story Continues
item.description: I am certain our Heavenly Father was mindful of her needs and wanted her to hear the comforting truths of the gospel.

item.title: A Royal Priesthood
item.description: Times may change, circumstances may alter, but the marks of a true holder of the priesthood of God remain constant.

item.title: Examples of Righteousness
item.description: It is our duty to live our lives in such a way that we may be examples of righteousness.

item.title: Looking Back and Moving Forward
item.description: Together we shall move forward doing His work.

item.title: Abundantly Blessed
item.description: Our testimonies have been strengthened. I believe we are all the more determined to live the principles of the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: To Learn, to Do, to Be
item.description: May we learn what we should learn, do what we should do, and be what we should be.

item.title: Finding Joy in the Journey
item.description: Let us relish life as we live it, find joy in the journey, and share our love with friends and family.

item.title: Until We Meet Again
item.description: May we be good citizens of the nations in which we live and good neighbors in our communities, reaching out to those of other faiths, as well as to our own.

item.title: Be Your Best Self
item.description: Each must strive to learn his duty and then to do it to the best of his ability.

item.title: Be of Good Cheer
item.description: Be of good cheer. The future is as bright as your faith.

item.title: Until We Meet Again
item.description: May we long remember that which we have heard during this conference. … I urge you to study the messages and to ponder their teachings and then to apply them in your life.

item.title: School Thy Feelings, O My Brother
item.description: If we desire to have a proper spirit with us at all times, we must choose to refrain from becoming angry.

item.title: What Have I Done for Someone Today?
item.description: The needs of others are ever present, and each of us can do something to help someone.

item.title: Closing Remarks
item.description: If we heed His words and live the commandments, we will survive this time of permissiveness and wickedness.

item.title: Preparation Brings Blessings
item.description: Let us consider our callings, let us reflect on our responsibilities, and let us follow Jesus Christ.

item.title: He Is Risen!
item.description: The empty tomb that first Easter morning was the answer to Job’s question, “If a man die, shall he live again?”

item.title: A Word at Closing
item.description: The lighthouse of the Lord sends forth signals readily recognized and never failing.

item.title: Charity Never Faileth
item.description: Rather than being judgmental and critical of each other, may we have the pure love of Christ for our fellow travelers in this journey through life.

item.title: As We Meet Together Again
item.description: Missionary service is a priesthood duty—an obligation the Lord expects of us who have been given so very much.

item.title: The Three Rs of Choice
item.description: Each of us has come to this earth with all the tools necessary to make correct choices.

item.title: The Divine Gift of Gratitude
item.description: A grateful heart … comes through expressing gratitude to our Heavenly Father for His blessings and to those around us for all that they bring into our lives.

item.title: Till We Meet Again
item.description: Endure to the end we must, for our goal is eternal life in the presence of our Father in Heaven.

item.title: It’s Conference Once Again
item.description: Thank you for your faith and devotion to the gospel, for the love and care you show to one another, and for the service you provide.

item.title: Priesthood Power
item.description: May we be worthy recipients of the divine power of the priesthood we bear. May it bless our lives and may we use it to bless the lives of others.

item.title: The Holy Temple—a Beacon to the World
item.description: The all-important and crowning blessings of membership in the Church are those blessings which we receive in the temples of God.

item.title: At Parting
item.description: None of us can conceive the full import of what Christ did for us in Gethsemane, but I am grateful every day of my life for His atoning sacrifice.

item.title: As We Meet Again
item.description: It is my prayer that we may be filled with the Spirit of the Lord as we listen to the messages today and tomorrow and learn those things the Lord would have us know.

item.title: Dare to Stand Alone
item.description: May we ever be courageous and prepared to stand for what we believe.

item.title: Stand in Holy Places
item.description: Communication with our Father in Heaven—including our prayers to Him and His inspiration to us—is necessary in order for us to weather the storms and trials of life.

item.title: Until We Meet Again
item.description: May the spirit we have felt here be and abide with us as we go about those things which occupy us each day.

item.title: Believe, Obey, and Endure
item.description: Believe that remaining strong and faithful to the truths of the gospel is of utmost importance. I testify that it is!

item.title: As We Gather Once Again
item.description: Our Heavenly Father is mindful of each of us and our needs. May we be filled with His Spirit as we partake of the proceedings of this conference.

item.title: Willing and Worthy to Serve
item.description: Miracles are everywhere to be found when the priesthood is understood, its power is honored and used properly, and faith is exerted.

item.title: The Race of Life
item.description: Where did we come from? Why are we here? Where do we go after this life? No longer need these universal questions remain unanswered.

item.title: As We Close This Conference
item.description: May you ponder the truths you have heard, and may they help you to become even better than you were when conference began.

item.title: See Others as They May Become
item.description: We must develop the capacity to see men not as they are at present but as they may become.

item.title: Consider the Blessings
item.description: Our Heavenly Father is aware of our needs and will help us as we call upon Him for assistance.

item.title: God Be with You Till We Meet Again
item.description: As we take the messages of the past two days into our hearts and into our lives, we will be blessed.

item.title: Come, All Ye Sons of God
item.description: May each one of us search the scriptures with diligence, plan his life with purpose, teach the truth with testimony, and serve the Lord with love.

item.title: Obedience Brings Blessings
item.description: A knowledge of truth and the answers to our greatest questions come to us as we are obedient to the commandments of God.

item.title: Until We Meet Again
item.description: I pray that the Lord will bless and keep you, my brothers and sisters. May His promised peace be with you now and always.

item.title: We Never Walk Alone
item.description: You will one day stand aside and look at your difficult times, and you will realize that He was always there beside you.

item.title: True Shepherds
item.description: Home teaching answers many prayers and permits us to see the transformations which can take place in people’s lives.

item.title: “I Will Not Fail Thee, nor Forsake Thee”
item.description: Our Heavenly Father … knows that we learn and grow and become stronger as we face and survive the trials through which we must pass.

item.title: Till We Meet Again
item.description: May we show increased kindness toward one another, and may we ever be found doing the work of the Lord.

item.title: Be Strong and of a Good Courage
item.description: Thomas S. Monson counsels priesthood holders to have moral courage in these challenging times and to be willing to defend their beliefs.

item.title: Love—the Essence of the Gospel
item.description: Thomas S. Monson teaches how small acts of love, kindness, and forgiveness can make a big difference in others' lives.

item.title: Until We Meet Again
item.description: Thomas S. Monson expresses his hope that the spirit Latter-day Saints felt during general conference may abide with them.

item.title: Guided Safely Home
item.description: Using the analogy of a ship, Thomas S. Monson teaches members to steer a course toward eternal life, with the rudder of faith.

item.title: Ponder the Path of Thy Feet
item.description: President Thomas S. Monson counsels us to walk in the path marked by the example and teachings of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Until We Meet Again
item.description: President Thomas S. Monson counsels us to serve others and be more valiant disciples and faithful followers of Christ.

item.title: The Priesthood—a Sacred Gift
item.description: Thomas S. Monson teaches priesthood holders to appreciate the gift of the priesthood, to live worthy of using its power, and to follow the Savior.

item.title: Blessings of the Temple
item.description: Thomas S. Monson teaches of the comfort, peace, and strength that can come to us as we attend the temple.

item.title: Keep the Commandments
item.description: President Thomas S. Monson encourages us to keep the commandments and identifies some of the blessings for doing so.

item.title: Be an Example and a Light
item.description: President Thomas S. Monson teaches us to be “an example of the believers” and a light to the world. I doing so, we will stand out, but as we make Christ the center of our lives, our fears will be replaced by courage.

item.title: Principles and Promises
item.description: President Monson testifies of the blessings that come as we obey the Word of Wisdom.

item.title: The Perfect Path to Happiness
item.description: President Monson testifies of the truthfulness of the plan of salvation, centered on Jesus Christ. We have a mandate to share and live the truth.

item.title: Kindness, Charity, and Love
item.description: President Monson teaches priesthood holders to follow the Savior’s example of kindness.

item.title: The Power of the Book of Mormon
item.description: President Monson encourages us to read the Book of Mormon every day so we can be protected from sin and evil through a stronger testimony of Jesus Christ.
